org.fosstrak.reader.rp.proxy.msg
Class ProxyConnection

java.lang.Object
  org.fosstrak.reader.rp.proxy.msg.ProxyConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Client
public class ProxyConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements Client

This class represents a proxy connection. Each reader device proxy owns such a connection. Over the method executeCommand() commands can be executed over this connection.

Author:
regli

          Constructor sets the parameters.

public ProxyConnection(java.lang.String host,
                       int port,
                       Handshake handshake)
Constructor sets the parameters.

Parameters:
host - of the reader device
port - of the reader device
handshake - indicates the message format and the transport protocol
Method Detail

connect

public boolean connect()
                throws RPProxyException
This method creates a new client connection and connects it to a reader device.

Returns:
true if the client connection is established
Throws:
RPProxyException - if the connection could not be created

disconnect

public boolean disconnect()
This method disconnects the client connection.

Returns:
true if the client connection is disconnected

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
This method indicates if the connection is connected to a reader device.

Returns:
true if the connection is connected and false otherwise

printInput

public void printInput(java.lang.String data)
This message is invoked if the client connection receives data.

Specified by:
printInput in interface Client
Parameters:
data - from the client connection

executeCommand

public Reply executeCommand(java.lang.String object,
                            java.lang.String command,
                            java.lang.Class[] parameterTypes,
                            java.lang.Object[] args,
                            java.lang.String target,
                            boolean ignoreNoReply)
                     throws ParameterTypeException,
                            RPProxyException
This method executes a command on the reader device over the proxy connection.

Parameters:
object - the type of the object on which the command should be executed
command - the command which should be executed
parameterTypes - the types of the parameters which belong to the command
args - the arguments which belong to the command
target - the name of the object on which the command shoud be executed
ignoreNoReply - indicates if it should be ignored if there is no reply or not
Returns:
the reply from the reader device
Throws:
ParameterTypeException - if the parameters are illegal
RPProxyException - if there is an error while executing the command
